Stone is a traditional journalist who left CNN for the Internet in 1997 and began developing new social media business models during her tenure as the first Internet journalist awarded a Nieman Fellowship from Harvard University in 2002. Stone first blogged as part of her 2004 election coverage for the Los Angeles Times, the same year she developed and launched the first sponsored blog network for Law.com.

Prior to the Nieman Fellowship, Lisa was among the early drivers of successful online communities and interactive programming for women. As the executive producer and Editor in Chief/VP, Programming for Women.com, Lisa grew the 18-channel network to a Top 30 site and oversaw all original programming and the development and integration of content community initiatives with Hearst and Rodale magazines, E!
